content: What do bees collect from flowers?
subject: reading
explanation: The passage states that bees collect nectar from flowers to make honey
passage: Bees are amazing insects that help plants grow. They fly from flower to flower collecting nectar, which they use to make honey. When bees visit flowers, pollen sticks to their fuzzy bodies. As they move from flower to flower, they spread this pollen around, helping plants make seeds. Without bees, many of our favorite fruits and vegetables wouldn't exist!

content: What are groups of dolphins called?
subject: reading
explanation: The passage states that dolphins live in groups called pods
passage: The ocean is home to many incredible creatures. Dolphins are smart marine mammals that live in groups called pods. They use clicking sounds to talk to each other and to find food underwater. Dolphins are very playful and often jump out of the water. They breathe air through a blowhole on top of their heads, just like whales do.
